nodes.name: AccommodationFacility
nodes.label: Accommodation facility
nodes.description: A building or collection of buildings without a singular purpose, but generally used for accommodation.

nodes.name: Action
nodes.label: Action
nodes.description: An activity, or the occurrence of an activity, that may utilise resources and may be focused against an objective.

nodes.name: Actor
nodes.label: Actor
nodes.description: Base actor category

nodes.name: Aircraft
nodes.label: Aircraft
nodes.description: A Vehicle that is designed to fly within the earth's atmosphere.

nodes.name: Airfield
nodes.label: Airfield
nodes.description: An area prepared for the accommodation (including buildings and installations) or equipment of landing and take-off of aircraft.

nodes.name: Anchorage
nodes.label: Anchorage
nodes.description: A place where a vessel may anchor, usually designated in charts, offering suitable holding ground and shelter.

nodes.name: Apron
nodes.label: Apron
nodes.description: A defined area on a land aerodrome intended to accommodate aircraft for the purposes of loading or unloading passengers, mail or cargo, fuelling, parking or maintenance.

nodes.name: Bank
nodes.label: Bank
nodes.description: An establishment where money is stored for saving or commercial purposes.

nodes.name: Barracks
nodes.label: Barracks
nodes.description: Military accommodation facility for personnel and unit support.

nodes.name: Basin
nodes.label: Basin
nodes.description: A partially enclosed, man-made or improved water area providing safe anchorage and berthing for vessels.

nodes.name: Berth
nodes.label: Berth
nodes.description: A designated location in a port or harbour where a vessel may be moored, usually alongside a quay, pier, or jetty.

nodes.name: Bivouac
nodes.label: Bivouac
nodes.description: Temporary encampment area for troops in the field.

nodes.name: Civilian
nodes.label: Civilian
nodes.description: A person who is not a member of the armed forces or other organized armed groups; generally protected from direct attack under the law of armed conflict.

nodes.name: Cropland
nodes.label: cropland
nodes.description: An area that has been tilled for the planting of crops.

nodes.name: Cryosphere
nodes.label: Cryosphere
nodes.description: Snow and ice environments (glaciers, pack ice, snowfields) that constrain movement, logistics, and signatures.

nodes.name: Ditch
nodes.label: Ditch
nodes.description: Linear excavation used as a military obstacle.

nodes.name: Equipment
nodes.label: Equipment
nodes.description: Materiel that is neither intended for consumption nor an unexploded piece of ordnance.

nodes.name: Facility
nodes.label: Facility
nodes.description: Base facility category

nodes.name: Facsimile
nodes.label: Facsimile
nodes.description: A service provided by means of electronic scanning of a document, transmitting it as data by telecommunications links, and producing an exact copy at the receiver.

nodes.name: Farm
nodes.label: farm
nodes.description: A tract of land, including buildings and structures, whose primary use is the production of food (for example: crops or livestock).

nodes.name: Ford
nodes.label: Ford
nodes.description: A shallow place in a river or stream allowing one to walk or drive across.

nodes.name: Fortification
nodes.label: Fortification
nodes.description: Military defensive works designed to strengthen a position against attack.

nodes.name: Harbour
nodes.label: Harbour
nodes.description: A sheltered area of water where ships, boats, and barges can be moored safely, often with port facilities.

nodes.name: Helipad
nodes.label: Helipad
nodes.description: A small, designated area (usually with a prepared surface) used for the take-off, landing, or parking of helicopters.

nodes.name: Heliport
nodes.label: Heliport
nodes.description: An aerodrome or defined area on a structure intended or used for the arrival, departure, and surface movement of helicopters.

nodes.name: Image
nodes.label: Image
nodes.description: An imagery product.

nodes.name: Jetty
nodes.label: Jetty
nodes.description: A structure projecting from the shore into a body of water to influence current or tide or to protect a harbour; also used for mooring vessels.

nodes.name: Lighthouse
nodes.label: Lighthouse
nodes.description: A tower or other structure with a powerful light that gives a continuous or intermittent signal to navigators.

nodes.name: Lock
nodes.label: Lock
nodes.description: An enclosed section of waterway with gates at each end, by which the level of water can be altered to raise or lower vessels as they pass through.

nodes.name: Market
nodes.label: Market
nodes.description: A facility where commercial activity is conducted and goods and services are bought and sold.

nodes.name: Materiel
nodes.label: Materiel
nodes.description: An apparatus, equipment or supply of military interest without distinction as to its application for administrative or combat purposes.

nodes.name: Military
nodes.label: Military
nodes.description: A person who serves in the regular armed forces of a state, subject to military law and organization.

nodes.name: Minefield
nodes.label: Minefield
nodes.description: Area seeded with land or sea mines as an obstacle.

nodes.name: Object
nodes.label: Object
nodes.description: An individually identified object that has military or civilian significance.

nodes.name: Office
nodes.label: Office
nodes.description: A place in which business, professional or clerical activities are conducted.

nodes.name: Orchard
nodes.label: orchard
nodes.description: A tract covered by systematic plantings of trees that yield fruits (including nuts).

nodes.name: Organisation
nodes.label: Organisation
nodes.description: An administrative or functional structure.

nodes.name: Paramilitary
nodes.label: Paramilitary
nodes.description: A person who belongs to a non-regular armed organization with military structure or functions (e.g., militias, gendarmerie, irregular forces), typically outside the standing armed forces.

nodes.name: Person
nodes.label: Person
nodes.description: A human being of military or civilian significance.

nodes.name: Pier
nodes.label: Pier
nodes.description: A platform supported on pillars or girders leading out from the shore into a body of water, used as a landing stage for boats.

nodes.name: Port
nodes.label: Port
nodes.description: A town or city with a harbour where ships load or unload, especially one where customs officers are stationed.

nodes.name: Quay
nodes.label: Quay
nodes.description: A solidly constructed platform, usually parallel to the shore, where a vessel can be loaded or unloaded on one side of the vessel only.

nodes.name: Railway
nodes.label: Railway
nodes.description: A permanent track composed of a line of parallel metal rails fixed to sleepers, for transport of passengers and goods in trains.

nodes.name: Road
nodes.label: Road
nodes.description: A wide way leading from one place to another, especially one with a specially prepared surface which vehicles can use.

nodes.name: Runway
nodes.label: Runway
nodes.description: A defined rectangular area on a land aerodrome prepared for the landing and take-off of aircraft.

nodes.name: Sensor
nodes.label: Sensor
nodes.description: A device that detects or measures a physical property and records, indicates, or otherwise responds to it.

nodes.name: Shop
nodes.label: Shop
nodes.description: A small retail store or a speciality department in a large store.

nodes.name: Slipway
nodes.label: Slipway
nodes.description: The prepared and usually reinforced inclined plane upon which the keel blocks are laid for supporting a vessel under construction.

nodes.name: Spacecraft
nodes.label: Spacecraft
nodes.description: A Vehicle that is capable of operating beyond the earth's atmosphere.

nodes.name: Tool
nodes.comment: An instrument with which some operation is performed; a means of effecting something.
nodes.label: Tool

nodes.name: Trail
nodes.label: Trail
nodes.description: A beaten path or track through rough country such as a forest or moor, used for travel or transport on foot, horseback, or by vehicle.

nodes.name: Tunnel
nodes.label: Tunnel
nodes.description: An underground or underwater passage dug through the surrounding soil/earth/rock and enclosed except for entry and exit, commonly used for road and rail traffic.

nodes.name: Unit
nodes.label: Unit
nodes.description: A MilitaryOrganisation whose structure is prescribed by competent authority.

nodes.name: Vehicle
nodes.label: Vehicle
nodes.description: A conveyance for transporting persons or things.

nodes.name: Vessel
nodes.label: Vessel
nodes.description: A Vehicle that is designed to operate on or under the water surface.

nodes.name: Weapon
nodes.label: Weapon
nodes.description: Equipment of any kind used in warfare or combat to attack and overcome an enemy.

nodes.name: Wetland
nodes.label: Wetland
nodes.description: Areas with water-saturated soils (marshes, swamps, bogs) that significantly affect maneuver, concealment, and engineering tasks.
